questions.text: Element used as a mood stabiliser + element essential for respiration + 78% of Earth's atmosphere is this element = The king of the jungle.
questions.explanation:
Lion.

	LiON. Li = Lithium. O = Oxygen. N = Nitrogen.

questions.text: Element that is also a shade of blue + element that forms a diamond + element responsible for hyperkalaemia + element named for the Greek word astatos, meaning unstable + element essential for respiration + element essential for respiration = Australian bird.
questions.explanation:
Cockatoo.

	CoCKAtOO. Co = Cobalt.  C = Carbon.  K = Potassium.  At = Astatine.  O = Oxygen.  O = Oxygen.

questions.text: Element named for the Greek word selene meaning moon + foil commonly used for wrapping food = Marine mammal.
questions.explanation:
Seal.

	SeAl.  Se = Selenium.  Al = Aluminium (or Aluminum).

questions.text: The lightest element + element that was originally named terbium + element essential for respiration + 78% of Earth's atmosphere is this element = Wading bird.
questions.explanation:
Heron.

	HErON.  H = Hydrogen.  Er = Erbium.  O = Oxygen.  N = Nitrogen.

questions.text: Element whose chemical symbol is also an abbreviation for 'Rhesus factor' + element named for the indigo line in its atomic spectrum + element essential for  respiration  + element that forms a diamond + element that was originally named terbium + element that shares its name with the debut album by George Clinton's band Parliament = Large endangered herbivore found in Africa and Asia.
questions.explanation:
Rhinoceros.

	RhInOCErOs.  Rh = Rhodium.  In = Indium.  O = Oxygen.  C = Carbon.  Er = Erbium.  Os = Osmium.

questions.text: Element also known as brimstone + the lightest element + the most abundant noble gas on Earth + element responsible for hyperkalaemia = Sea predator.
questions.explanation:
Shark.

	SHArK.  S = Sulfur (or Sulphur).  H = Hydrogen.  Ar = Argon.  K = Potassium.

questions.text: This element is not lead, but it is named for the Greek word molybdos, meaning lead + element essential for respiration + element named for the Greek word selene meaning moon = The largest living member of the deer family.
questions.explanation:
Moose.

	MoOSe.  Mo = Molybdenum.  O = Oxygen.  Se = Selenium.

questions.text: Element whose name comes from the same root at the English word tantalize + element used in fertiliser, which gives its name to the ability to glow without burning + corrosion-resistant element named for the Greek word for rainbow = Animal that resembles a pig, but is actually closely related to other odd-toed hooved animals such as the horse or rhinoceros.
questions.explanation:
Tapir.

	TaPIr.  Ta = Tantalum.  P = Phosphorus.  Ir = Iridium.

questions.text: Element that is also a shade of blue + dark brown element used in pyrotechnic flares to produce a green flame + radio active element discovered by Marie Curie in 1898 = A venomous snake.
questions.explanation:
Cobra.

	CoBRa.  Co = Cobalt.  B = Boron.  Ra = Radium.

questions.text: Radio active element discovered by Marie Curie in 1898 + element that forms a diamond + element that is also a shade of blue + element essential respiration + 78% of Earth's atmosphere is this element = A nocturnal mammal known for having a black mask around its eyes.
questions.explanation:
Raccoon.

	RaCCoON.  Ra = Radium.  C = Carbon.  Co = Cobalt.  O = Oxygen.  N = Nitrogen.
